derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English raisons of Corauntz, translating Anglo-Norman French raisins de Corauntz 'grapes of Corinth' (the original source)

entry.def: Currants are small dried black grapes, used especially in cakes.
Currants are bushes which produce edible red, black, or white berries. The berries are also called currants .

means.word_mean: 1. any of several tart red or black berries used primarily for jellies and jams
2. any of various deciduous shrubs of the genus Ribes bearing currants
3. small dried seedless raisin grown in the Mediterranean region and California; used in cooking
